channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Clothes and rubbish beside recycling bin and blocking pavement, 9th January
item.description:
Was reported two days ago, update said fixed but lt was never cleared Updated photo from 8am today

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Webber Street, Southwark, Greater London

item.title: Dumped cupboard doors, 9th January
item.description:

item.title: Litter on Riverdale road Erith, 9th January

item.title: Rubbish left in road by refuse colletion team!!, 9th January
item.description:
Rubbish left in road by bexley councils refuse collection team, this is causing a dangerous situation for motorcyles and cars,why they could not use a shovel to scoop up is beyond me, they supposed to collect not dump rubbish!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Paroma Road, Lower Belvedere, Greater London

item.title: Mattress dumped blocking pavement, 9th January
item.description:
Some lowlife has dumped their mattress on the pavement making mums with pushchairs go into the road to pass.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ambrooke Road, Lower Belvedere, Greater London

item.title: 2nd time fix my street have said its been resolved and it hasnt, 9th January
item.description:
What is the point of this service if all you do is lie!!! Twice i have reported this and recieved email to say its been resolved. When im quite clearly looking at it now!!I would like to raise a formal complaint.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): King and Queen Street, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drains blocked and road flooded, 9th January
item.description:
The road is dangerous as blocked drains has caused flooding. This repeats whenever it rains

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wigley Bush Lane, Brentwood

item.title: Graffiti, 9th January
item.description:
The scaffolding put up by Hackney has been used as a platform for graffiti - there was zero graffiti before this platform was put up. Please remove the scaffolding and graffiti without delay.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pownall Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish was collected from everyone but this, 9th January
item.description:
Rubbish collection hasn’t come since before Christmas and bins are overflowing. Saw them collecting all other bins on my street apart from those.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gould Terrace, Hackney, London

item.title: Suotcases etc blocking pavement on April Street E8, 9th January
item.description:
Hello, please can you remove the dumped suitcases etc left on April Street E8, that are blocking the pavement? Thank you

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): April Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Bikes blocking and fall on street of Blandford street near baker street 55 building around, 9th January
item.description:
Human forest Bikes need to fix it as it's on floor amd blocking pavement around 55 baker street building Blandford street side causing hazard and nuisance

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 43-45, Baker Street, Marylebone, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive puddles on corner of St Mary’s Close, 9th January
item.description:
There’s a massive puddle on the corner of St Mary’s Close which happens every time it rain and the puddle covers the whole of the entrance to St Mary’s Close including the drop pavement on which school children have to cross . You get soaked trying to cross there . I’ve reported this so many times now not just because of the puddle but the thick black slippery mud that it leaves behind.so can this be looked at and cleared Piease

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1,2, St. Mary's Close, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tonne bags dumped, 9th January
item.description:
Council marked as fixed when it clearly isn't. Tonnes bags been in the alley for weeks now, causing obstruction with residents bins and entrances.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Webb Road, Blackheath
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two very deep potholes, 9th January
item.description:
There two very deep potholes which are very dangerous. I fell on them and will need to take the car to the mechanic to see if there is any damage to the wheels. I witnessed car after car falling in them. Please send someone ASAP before someone gets hurt. They could be manhole covers I couldn't tell as it was dark.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 75, Avenue Road, Southgate, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
